isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ALLISON 2000 SERIES ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM POWER SOURCE

svcproc.title: ALLISON 2000 SERIES ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM POWER SOURCE

svcsubproc.title: 4700 Series Models
svcsubproc.para: The TCM receives battery power at all times and ignition power when the key is ON.

BATTERY POWER - Power from the positive terminal of the batteries is delivered on circuit 14B to connector (426), through circuit A336 to dash connector (13), through circuit 14T to 10 amp fuse (3039) pins 3 & 4, through circuit 103 to TCM/Cab connector (3034), through circuit 103 to grey TCM connector (3031) pin 3.

IGNITION POWER - With the key ON, ignition power from the key switch (24) is delivered through circuit 13J to ABS/Allison connector (377), through circuit 13J to 10 amp fuse (3039) pins 1 & 2, through circuit 13M and 13MF to TCM/Cab connector (3034), through circuit 13MF, splitting to circuits 102 & 104 to grey TCM connector (3031) pins 4 & 2.

The ignition voltage acts as an ON/OFF switch for the TCM and provides ignition power to the range inhibit light, mode select switch indicator light, exhaust brake switch and the relays located in the rear of the cab.

svcsubproc.title: 3800 Model
svcsubproc.para: The TCM receives battery power at all times and ignition power when the key is ON.

BATTERY POWER - Power from the positive terminal of the batteries is delivered on circuit 14A to connector (426), through circuit 14B and 14D to 10 amp fuse (3055) pins B & A, through circuit 103A to grey TCM connector (3031) pin 3.

IGNITION POWER - With the key ON, ignition power from the key switch (24) is delivered through circuit 13J to ABS/Allison connector (377), through circuit 13E and 13M to transmission harness connector (3036), through circuit 13J, splitting to circuits 102 & 104, to grey TCM connector (3031) pins 4 & 2.

The ignition voltage acts as an ON/OFF switch for the TCM and provides ignition power to the range inhibit light, mode select switch indicator light, exhaust brake switch and the relays located in the rear of the cab.

svcsubproc.title: 3400 Model
svcsubproc.para: The TCM receives battery power at all times and ignition power when the key is ON.

BATTERY POWER - Power from the positive terminal of the batteries is delivered on circuit 14A, through a 40 or 15 amp fuse to circuit 14B and connector (426). From connector (426), power is applied to circuit 14C, 10 amp fuse (3055) pins B & A, through circuit 103A to grey TCM connector (3031) pin 3.

IGNITION POWER - With the key ON, ignition power from the key switch (24) is delivered through circuit 13J to ABS/Allison connector (377), through circuit 13J to 10 amp fuse (301) pins 4 & 3, through circuit 13K and 13MF to transmission harness connector (3036), through circuit 13J, splitting to circuits 102 & 104, to grey TCM connector (3031) pins 4 & 2.

The ignition voltage acts as an ON/OFF switch for the TCM and provides ignition power to the range inhibit light, mode select switch indicator light, exhaust brake switch and the relays located in the rear of the cab.
